title: geth fast sync mode keeps showing lower and lower currentBlock, some blocks (back ~10%) were lost after restart
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `v1.9.25-unstable`
OS & Version: Docker on Ubuntu 18.04

#### Behaviour
I have had a fully synced fast-mode node, until yesterday.

First of all, about 10% of block (back to 9mm from 11mm fully synced) were lost after a restart. The worse thing is:
using web3py to get information on the node sync status:
````python
from web3 import Web3
w3 = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider('http://127.0.0.1:8545'))
print(w3.eth.syncing)
````
and the value of `currentBlock` keeps getting lower and lower (which is both visible with the `w3.eth.syncing` and geth ouput), as well as `startingBlock` is also getting lower.
```
AttributeDict({'currentBlock': 9115910, 'highestBlock': 11372263, 'knownStates': 637709461, 'pulledStates': 637709460, 'startingBlock': 9117767})
AttributeDict({'currentBlock': 9115910, 'highestBlock': 11372263, 'knownStates': 637709461, 'pulledStates': 637709460, 'startingBlock': 9115910})
```

Your node never finish the fast sync I guess. You can see the `Loaded most recent local full block` is always zero which will only be set when the state is synced.

**Why the blockchain keep rewinding?**
It's becase you only have 2 peers, while these 2 peers can't provide the request state for you. So the syncing is aborted.
`err="trie node 14756d…a42d7c failed with all peers (2 tries, 2 peers)"`

**How can you fix it?**
Can you please check that the p2p port(e.g. 30303) is exposed if you are running on the cloud? It can help with the connection.
@rjl493456442 answered this correctly -- the sync isn't finished, due to peering problems
